info.name: Nutrition Rest Api
info.description: This API allows you to track your daily consumed nutrient intake and provides a better view of how much nutrients you need to consume on a daily basis. Based on your height, weight, workout status, and gender, you can see how many calories you need to consume and, based on that, what macros you need.

request.description: You can view everything about electrolytes in this endpoint. You can add the name after that, and you will get only the information for the given electrolyte. If you add an incorrect name, you will receive a list that tells you which are the correct names. No authentication required. Check the examples.

response.name: GetAllElectorlyts
ElectolyteCorrectName
ElectrolyteWrongName
response.body:
Electrolyte with name 'salta' does not existed in the data.
The available search names are: Sodium,Potassium,Calcium,Magnesium,Chloride

request.description: You can view everything about vitamins in this endpoint. You can add the name after that, and you will get only the information for the given vitamin. If you add an incorrect name, you will receive a list that tells you which are the correct names. No authentication required. Check the examples.

response.name: GetAllVitamins
GetAVitaminByNameCorrect
GetVitaminByNameWrong
response.body:
Vitamin with name a- does not existed in the data.
The available search names are: A,D,E,K,C,B1,B2,B3,B5,B6,B7,B9,B12

request.description: You can view everything about macronutrients in this endpoint. You can add the name after that, and you will get only the information for the given macro. If you add an incorrect name, you will receive a list that tells you which are the correct names. No authentication required. Check the examples.

response.name: GetAllMacronutrients
MacronutrientWithCorrectName
MacronutrientWithWrongName
response.body:
Electrolyte with name 'Fataa' does not existed in the data.
The available search names are: Carbohydrates,Protein,Fat

request.description:
There are 8 fields, but you only need to fill in 3 of them. If you fill all of them, you will achieve 'Complete Registration,' which will allow you to use the 'Records' endpoints. There are some restrictions:

- Name cannot be empty and must be at least 4 letters long.
    
- Email should not be empty, must be in email format, and must not have been used before.
    
- Password must not be blank and must be at least 5 letters long.
    

Check the example.

response.name: Failed Registration 1
response.body: email : email already exits

response.name: Failed Registration 2
response.body:
password : must not be blank
username : must not be blank
email : must not be blank

response.name: Successful 1
response.body: Successfuly created account

response.name: Successful with all fields
response.body: Successfuly created account

request.description: After registration, if you enter your email and password correctly, you will receive a 'Bearer' token, which you need to use for authorization in the next features.

response.name: Successful login
response.body: eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxIiwiZXhwIjoxNjkyNzAyMzExfQ.yk7WF35KHXvmoJjXYA8ZiprQYQefNCdLTB5acbYpRJo

response.name: Failed login
response.body:
email : must not be blank
password : must not be blank
password : wrong username or password

request.description: This feature allows you to view your profile. You need to be authenticated to access this. From here, you can see which fields are not filled, and after you fill them all, you will achieve 'UserDetails_COMPLETED' status.

response.name: User Details 1
response.body:
{
    "id": 1,
    "username": "test",
    "email": "test@abv.bg",
    "kilograms": 82,
    "height": 186,
    "workoutState": "MODERATELY_ACTIVE",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "userDetails": "COMPLETED",
    "age": 25
}

response.name: User Details 2
response.body:
{
    "id": 3,
    "username": "valid",
    "email": "valid@abv.bg",
    "kilograms": null,
    "height": null,
    "workoutState": null,
    "gender": null,
    "userDetails": "NOT_COMPLETED",
    "age": null
}

response.name: Change User Details
response.body:
{
    "id": 3,
    "username": "valid",
    "email": "valid@abv.bg",
    "kilograms": 23,
    "height": 23,
    "workoutState": "MODERATELY_ACTIVE",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "userDetails": "COMPLETED",
    "age": 25
}

request.description:
You need to be fully registered (UserDetails_Completed) to use this feature. This allows you to see all of your nutrition records.

Everything is calculated based on the information that you have filled in. For example, if my height is 23 and my weight is 23, I need to consume 731 calories per day, which automatically calculates how much macro I need.

request.description: During this feature, you can change the record of the currently logged-in user. If you try to change a record that belongs to another user, you will receive a 'BadRequest' error. The parameters for changing the nutrition in each request are (name and measure). Please check the examples for more details.

response.name: Invalid Record Id
response.body: Record with the given day 1 does not existed in the data.

response.name: Invalid Body
response.body:
This does not match any nutrient in the dalyRecord/dataBase
All available macros names: Carbohydrates,Protein,Fat
All available vitamins names: A,D,E,K,C,B1,B2,B3,B5,B6,B7,B9,B12
All available electrolytes names: Sodium,Potassium,Calcium,Magnesium,Chloride

response.name: Successful Change
response.body:
{
    "id": 83,
    "nutrientName": "Protein",
    "nutrientType": "Macronutrient",
    "lowerBoundIntake": 46.13,
    "upperBoundIntake": 46.13,
    "dailyConsumed": 218,
    "measurement": "grams (g)",
    "recordId": 4
}

request.description: Hitting this endpoint will automatically create a new record, and it will be shown in the response.

request.description: If you want to delete a record, you need to provide the correct recordID. If you pass a recordID that belongs to another user, you will receive a 'BadRequest' error.

response.name: Invalid Record ID
response.body: Record with the given day 1 does not existed in the data.
